com.example.textdrawable.drawable

Class TextDrawable

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.graphics.drawable.Drawable
      • com.example.textdrawable.drawable.TextDrawable

  • public class TextDrawable
extends android.graphics.drawable.Drawable
    A Drawable object that draws text. A TextDrawable accepts most of the same parameters that can be applied to TextView for displaying and formatting text. Optionally, a Path may be supplied on which to draw the text. A TextDrawable has an intrinsic size equal to that required to draw all the text it has been supplied, when possible. In cases where a Path has been supplied, the caller must explicitly call setBounds() to provide the Drawable size based on the Path constraints.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • getTextAlign

        public android.text.Layout.Alignment getTextAlign()
        Return the current text alignment setting

      • setTextAlign

        public void setTextAlign(android.text.Layout.Alignment align)
        Set the text alignment. The alignment itself is based on the text layout direction. For LTR text NORMAL is left aligned and OPPOSITE is right aligned. For RTL text, those alignments are reversed.
        Parameters:
        align - Text alignment value. Should be set to one of: Layout.Alignment#ALIGN_NORMAL, Layout.Alignment#ALIGN_NORMAL, Layout.Alignment#ALIGN_OPPOSITE.

      • setTypeface

        public void setTypeface(android.graphics.Typeface tf)
        Sets the typeface and style in which the text should be displayed. Note that not all Typeface families actually have bold and italic variants, so you may need to use setTypeface(Typeface, int) to get the appearance that you actually want.

      • setTypeface

        public void setTypeface(android.graphics.Typeface tf,
               int style)
        Sets the typeface and style in which the text should be displayed, and turns on the fake bold and italic bits in the Paint if the Typeface that you provided does not have all the bits in the style that you specified.

      • getTypeface

        public android.graphics.Typeface getTypeface()
        Return the current typeface and style that the Paint using for display.

      • setTextColor

        public void setTextColor(int color)
        Set a single text color for all states
        Parameters:
        color - Color value such as Color.WHITE or Color.argb(int, int, int, int)

      • setTextColor

        public void setTextColor(android.content.res.ColorStateList colorStateList)
        Set the text color as a state list
        Parameters:
        colorStateList - ColorStateList of text colors, such as inflated from an R.color resource

      • setTextPath

        public void setTextPath(android.graphics.Path path)
        Optional Path object on which to draw the text. If this is set, TextDrawable cannot properly measure the bounds this drawable will need. You must call setBounds() before applying this TextDrawable to any View. Calling this method with null will remove any Path currently attached.

      • measureContent

        private void measureContent()
        Internal method to take measurements of the current contents and apply the correct bounds when possible.
